tn.ref: This is a declaration of Yahweh's word concerning
tn.text: AT: "This is Yahweh's message about"

tn.ref: the land of Hadrach and Damascus
tn.text: AT: "the people of the land of Hadrach and the city Damascus (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]]) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: For Yahweh's eye is on all mankind
tn.text: AT: "For Yahweh is watching every person" However, many modern versions translate this passage as "mankind's eyes and those of all the tribes of Israel are on Yahweh."

tn.ref: Hamath
tn.text: AT: "the people of the land of Hamath" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: Tyre and Sidon
tn.text: AT: "the people of Tyre and Sidon" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: though they are very wise
tn.text: Zechariah probably did not really mean that the people of Hamath were wise. AT: "though they think they are very wise" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_irony]])

tn.ref: built herself a stronghold
tn.text: Here the city of Tyre is pictured as a woman. AT: "built a strong fortress" or "built a high wall" (See [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]])

tn.ref: heaped up silver like dust and refined gold like mud in the streets
tn.text: AT: "accumulated silver and gold as much as soil in the streets" (See [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]])

tn.ref: Look! The Lord will dispossess her
tn.text: AT: "Pay attention! The Lord will take away Tyre's possessions"

tn.ref: and destroy her strength on the sea
tn.text: AT: "and destroy Tyre's ships in which men fight on the sea" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])

tn.ref: so she will be devoured by fire
tn.text: AT: "and burn the city to the ground"

tn.ref: will see
tn.text: "will see Tyre be destroyed"

tn.ref: Strangers will make their homes in Ashdod
tn.text: AT: "Foreigners will take over Ashdod and live there"

tn.ref: and I will cut off the pride of the Philistines
tn.text: AT: "I will make the Philistines to be proud of themselves no longer"

tn.ref: I will remove their blood from their mouths and their abominations from between their teeth
tn.text: These refer to meat with blood in it, and to meat offered to idols. The UDB makes this explicit. AT: "I will no longer allow them to eat meat that still has blood in it, and I will forbid them to eat food that they offered to idols" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: I will camp around my land
tn.text: God is speaking about himself as if he were an army. AT: "I will protect my land" (UDB). (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: Shout with great joy, daughter of Zion! Shout with happiness, daughter of Jerusalem!
tn.text: These two sentences mean the same thing and intensify the command to rejoice. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])

tn.ref: daughter of Zion ... daughter of Jerusalem
tn.text: "Zion" is the same as "Jerusalem." The prophet speaks of the city as if it is a daughter. See how you translated "daughter of Zion" in [[:en:bible:notes:zec:02:10|2:10]].

tn.ref: on a donkey, on the colt of a donkey
tn.text: These two phrases mean basically the same thing and refer to one animal. The second phrase clarifies that this is a young donkey. AT: "on a young donkey." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])

tn.ref: cut off the chariot from Ephraim
tn.text: AT: "destroy the chariots in Israel that are used for battle"

tn.ref: the horse from Jerusalem
tn.text: AT: "the warhorses in Jerusalem"

tn.ref: the bow will be cut off from battle
tn.text: Here the bow represents all weapons used in warfare. AT: "all weapons of war will be destroyed" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])

tn.ref: for he will speak peace to the nations
tn.text: Here the action of announcing peace represents the action of making peace. AT: "for your king will bring peace to the nations" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]]}

tn.ref: his dominion will be from sea to sea, and from the River to the ends of the earth!
tn.text: "his kingdom will be over all the earth!" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])

tn.ref: As for you
tn.text: Here "you" refers to the people of Israel.

tn.ref: the pit where there is no water
tn.text: This pit represents the exile. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: Return to the stronghold
tn.text: AT: "Come back to your nation where you will be safe"

tn.ref: prisoners of hope
tn.text: This expression refers to the Israelites in exile who were still trusting in God to rescue them.

tn.ref: bent Judah as my bow
tn.text: The people of Judah are referred to as if they were a bow carried by God into battle. AT: "I will use the people of Judah to fight against the people of Greece" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: filled my quiver with Ephraim
tn.text: The people of Israel, the northern kingdom, are referred to as if they were arrows that God would shoot at his enemies. A quiver is a bag that holds a soldier's arrows. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: I have roused your sons, Zion, against your sons, Greece
tn.text: God is speaking to the people of two different nations at the same time. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: General Information:
tn.text: This part of the prophecy continues with Hosea's words, instead of with Yahweh's words spoken through him.

tn.ref: will appear to them
tn.text: The word "them" refers to God's people. AT: "will be seen in the sky by his people" or "will come to his people"

tn.ref: will shoot out like lightning!
tn.text: The Israelites sometimes thought of lightning bolts as arrows that God shot.

tn.ref: blow the trumpet
tn.text: The trumpets were rams' horns. People will blow into them to give signals in battle and on other occasions.

tn.ref: will advance with the storms from Teman
tn.text: The Israelites sometimes thought of God as traveling on violent storms coming from the south.

tn.ref: will devour
tn.text: AT: "will completely defeat" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: defeat the stones of the slings
tn.text: The Israelites will defeat the soldiers who fight with slingshots. These soldiers represent all the enemies of Israel, no matter what weapons they are carrying. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: Then they will drink and shout like men drunk on wine
tn.text: AT: "They will shout and celebrate their victory as loudly as if they were drunk." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])

tn.ref: they will be filled with wine like bowls
tn.text: This probably refers to the bowls that the priests used to carry animal's blood to the altar. AT: "they will be as full of wine as the basins with which priests carry blood to the altar"

tn.ref: like the corners of the altar
tn.text: Altars had projecting corners where animal blood collected. AT: "as the corners of the altar are full of blood"

tn.ref: General Information:
tn.text: Zechariah continues talking to the people.

tn.ref: for they will be the jewels of a crown
tn.text: AT: "in our land they will be like beautiful stones in a crown" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])

tn.ref: The young men will flourish on grain
tn.text: The young men will live on food they receive from the harvest.

tn.ref: and the virgins on sweet wine
tn.text: Young women will enjoy new wine. These references to young men and young women represent the entire population of Israel. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
